intro: Cervicina denudata, commonly known as the naked cervicorn, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes many diverse and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, pale green flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments. Due to habitat loss, Cervicina denudata is considered endangered and is of particular interest to botanists and conservationists.
